data.title: Music History Events: Births
data.meta_description: List of events in music history for the category Births
data.text:
Alan "Bam" King (lead guitarist for Ace) is born in Kentish Town, London, England.

Ola Brunkert (session drummer for ABBA) is born in Orebro, Sweden.

Pete Agnew (bassist for Nazareth) is born in Dunfermline, Scotland.

Don Powell (drummer for Slade) is born in Bilston, Wolverhampton, Staffordshire, England. He would become interested in drums as a Boy Scout.

Soul singer Inez Foxx is born in Greensboro, North Carolina.

Doug Ingle (vocalist/organist for Iron Butterfly) is born in Omaha, Nebraska.

Bruce Palmer (bassist for Buffalo Springfield) is born in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.

Trevor Leslie Oaks (guitarist for Showaddywaddy) is born in Leicester, Leicestershire, England.

Dean Daughtry (keyboardist for Atlanta Rhythm Section) is born in Kinston, Alabama.

Disco/soul singer Alfa Anderson (of Chic) is born in Augusta, Georgia.

Dean Ford (lead singer for Marmalade) is born Thomas McAleese in Coatbridge, Scotland.

Rock drummer Buddy Miles (of The Electric Flag and Jimi Hendrix's Band Of Gypsys) is born George Allen Miles Jr. in Omaha, Nebraska. His grandmother calls him "Buddy" after jazz drummer Buddy Rich.

Folk rocker Loudon Wainwright III is born in Chapel Hill, North Carolina, to Life magazine columnist/editor Loudon Wainwright Jr. and his yoga teacher wife, Martha.

Rocker Marty Grebb (of The Buckinghams) is born in Chicago, Illinois.

Billy Preston is born in Houston, Texas. He is raised in Los Angeles, California. Aside from being a sought-after session musician for acts like The Beatles and The Rolling Stones, the affable performer with the gap-toothed grin becomes a star in his own right with a number of funky hits throughout the '70s.More

Greg Errico (drummer for Sly & the Family Stone) is born in San Francisco, California.

Barry Gibb of The Bee Gees is born in Douglas, Isle of Man. He is raised in Manchester, England.

Rock singer Jim Sohns (of The Shadows Of Knight) is born in Chicago, Illinois. The band is known for their popular 1966 cover of Them's song "Gloria."

Keith Moon (drummer for The Who) is born in Wembley, London, England.

Gary "Mutha" Withem (keyboardist for Gary Puckett & the Union Gap) is born in San Diego, California.

Ralf Hutter (lead singer, keyboardist for Kraftwerk) is born in Krefeld, Rhine Province, Germany.

Gordon Fleet (drummer for The Easybeats) is born in Merseyside, England.

Singer/songwriter/composer Jimmy Webb is born in Elk City, Oklahoma.

Bass guitarist Larry Graham (of Sly and the Family Stone) is born in Beaumont, Texas.

Mick Clarke (bass player/vocalist for the Rubettes) is born in Grimsby, Lincolnshire, England.

John Parry (trombonist for The Bonzo Dog Doo-Dah Band) is born.

Marinus "Rinus" Gerritsen (bassist, keyboardist for Golden Earring) is born in The Hague, South Holland, Netherlands.

Allan Holdsworth (guitarist for Soft Machine) is born in Bradford, West Yorkshire, England.

John York (bass guitarist for The Byrds) is born in White Plains, New York.

Boz Burrell (bass player for Bad Company) is born in Holbeach, Lincolnshire, England.
